ARABIC: فَقُولَا لَهُۥ قَوْلًا لَّيِّنًا لَّعَلَّهُۥ يَتَذَكَّرُ أَوْ يَخْشَىٰ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But speak to him with gentle words so that hopefully he will pay heed or show some fear.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Speak to him gently. He may possibly take heed or may come to have fear."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and speak to him gently, perhaps he may take heed or fear (Allah)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Both of you must speak with him in a gentle manner so that perhaps he may come to himself or have fear (of God)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “And speak to him courteously, that perhaps he may ponder or have some fear.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And speak to him mildly, perhaps he may accept admonition or fear (Allah).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then speak to him a gentle word haply he may mind or fear.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: yet speak gently to him, that haply he may be mindful, or perchance fear.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And speak unto him a gentle word, that peradventure he may heed or fear.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But speak gently to him; perhaps he may yet take heed or even feel afraid."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then say to him a gentle saying; haply he may be admonished or he may fear.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Speak to him in a soft manner; maybe he will take admonition or fear.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But speak to him mildly; perchance he may take warning or fear (Allah)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And speak to him mildly, perhaps he may accept admonition or fear Allah."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Speak to him with gentle words; perhaps he will ponder or fear'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But speak to him nicely. Perhaps he will remember, or have some fear.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And speak to him with gentle speech that perhaps he may be reminded or fear [Allah]."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [20:44] And speak to him gentle words, for him to renounce such [claims], that perhaps he may be mindful, be admonished, or fear’, God and so repent — the ‘hope’ [for Pharaoh’s repentance] is [expressed] from their perspective, for God knows that he was not going to repent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And speak unto him a gentle word) a kind word: "there is no deity except Allah"; it is also said that this means: call him by his agnomen, (that peradventure he may heed) that perhaps he may take admonition (or fear) or surrender [to Allah].
